artists.name: Nelson Rockwood
artists.title: General Contractor
artists.blurb: Nelson is the only general contractor that could’ve remodeled this house, ‘cuz he’s the only one I’ve ever met with a degree in theatre. Talk about a perfect fit! His hand was in everything, literally, in the house, over the last two years.

artists.name: Ann Tucker
artists.title: Interior Designer
artists.blurb: Ann Tucker is a local interior decorator who’s knowledge, artistry and excitement are unmatched. Her hand is in everything, not just the interior, from the octopus all the way to the creek.

artists.name: Mishka Westell
artists.title: Mural Designer
artists.blurb: Mishka is a local artist that specializes in poster art for famous bands. The Octopus House is based on a poster that she made. Also, she’s a total badass.

artists.title: Metal Forgers
artists.blurb: The folks at Pyrology created the mermaid. Isn’t she a beauty! I was privileged to visit their foundry and see them pour metal at thousands of degrees and shape it into fine art.

artists.name: Daniel Hornung
artists.title: Glass Sculptor
artists.blurb: Designing the mermaid was tricky and Daniel was the perfect guy for the job. Do we go classic or mod patina? How does it integrate with the rest? Only Daniel had the chops for this one.

artists.name: Jim Berry
artists.title: Glass Worker
artists.blurb: Jim is an amazing local artist that has been designing and teaching stained glass for decades. His tentacle and starfish stained glass are truly works of incomparable art.

artists.name: Heidi Choate
artists.title: Landscaper
artists.blurb: Heidi is an amazing landscaper and human being. Not only did she design the most interesting yards in Austin but she’s also a true joy to work with.

artists.name: Dan Johanson
artists.title: Water Feature Designer
artists.blurb: The water features out front and back are so absolutely beautiful and calming. Everyone that sees them says so. They bring me joy daily.

artists.name: Craig and Teena
artists.title: Wood Carvers
artists.blurb: Craig and Teena did an amazing job at creating the front door, which was especially challenging for its stained glass integration and custom non-linear wave design. Wow!

artists.name: Stuart Simpson
artists.title: Stone Sculptor
artists.blurb: This has been such a wonderful project to be a part of. Joey has been an absolute delight to work with, and has encouraged me from the get-go to use my artistic license, and have fun with the project, which in return has allowed me to fabricate something truly special. Nelson has also been a solid team member to collaborate with throughout the process. This is exactly the type of work I love to do and I am so grateful for this opportunity!

artists.name: Anna B.
artists.title: Skull Artist
artists.blurb: Anna is a local artist that created the Eyes of Texas longhorn skull, which tells the tale of Texas in thousands of beads. Seeing her art under rainbow lights just takes your breath away. Truly.

artists.name: James Talbot
artists.title: Artist Extraordinaire
artists.blurb: My house is nothing compared to Mr. Talbot’s home: Casa Neverlandia. You haven’t lived until you’ve taken a tour of his art house.

artists.name: Evan Voyles
artists.title: Neon Glass Artist
artists.blurb: Evan is a local neon artist and musician. Working with him and getting to know him has been one of the great pleasures of my life.

artists.name: Aaron Flynn
artists.title: Mural Painter
artists.blurb: Aaron Flynn is a local artist that painted the front of the Octopus House, based on Mishka’s design. There’s nothing more zen than watching Aaron paint. Truly.

artists.name: Stuart and Dave
artists.title: Steel Artist
artists.blurb: Stuart is a local artist that spend eight months of his life turning two tons of limestone is to a sculpture of Mother Nature, using everything from hydraulic chisels to X-acto knives. Really. He did that.

artists.name: Leo Mejilla
artists.title: Ninja Painter
artists.blurb: Leo is a local painter that virtually painted everything inside and outside of the house. And he’s a ninja! No, seriously, you don’t even know he’s there. Quietest human being I’ve ever met.

artists.name: Donny, Hugo and Brandon
artists.title: Home Automation
artists.blurb: The lights! Oh, the rainbow lights! You haven’t really seen the house until you hit a Rainbow button light switch or lit up the deck concert lights. Wow!

artists.name: Michael
artists.title: Tile Artist
artists.blurb: Watching Michael tile is simply fascinating. Morrocan tile is quite challenging and he did an amazing job laying it out.

artists.name: Aaron Pratt
artists.title: Cabinet Artist
artists.blurb: Aaron took an empty nook in my bedroom and turned it into a bookcase work of art. You can pull a book or a ukelele down! How cool is that?

artists.name: Wade Burleigh
artists.title: Wood Carver
artists.blurb: When Wade isn’t carving wood, he is Santa Claus himself.  He turned an ordinary stump into one of the most awesomely weird and unique pieces of art for the house.

artifacts.name: THE FACE
artifacts.blurb: The integration of multiple mediums into a non-linear mural sets this beautiful Octopus art house apart from all others.

artifacts.name: THE MERMAID
artifacts.blurb: The mermaid, forged in fire, and patinaed with love, will last a lifetime. She’s perfectly balanced so that she can spin to see all that she encompasses.

artifacts.name: THE DOOR
artifacts.blurb: Carving African Mahogany into waves on an irregular door is no easy feat but it was done so masterfully here.

artifacts.name: THE STAINED GLASS
artifacts.blurb: The stained glass tentacle and front door starfish are truly works of art that bring beautiful light into my life daily.

artifacts.name: NEON SEAHORSE
artifacts.blurb: The neon seahorse, which shines so brightly at night, watches over the house as the rest of the fish sleep.

artifacts.name: EYES OF TEXAS
artifacts.blurb: The longhorn is a Texas icon and what better way to show it then with thousands of beads under rainbow lights.

artifacts.name: SACRED SPACE
artifacts.blurb: Walking under this piece of art as I head to bed each night brings me joy and serenity. What a joy to behold 19,000 beads perfectly arranged.

artifacts.name: MOTHER NATURE
artifacts.blurb: She started as two tons of Texas limestone and eight months later we had a true goddess on our hands.

artifacts.name: THE WATERFALLS
artifacts.blurb: Flowing water is a soothing sound and these water features are no exception.

artifacts.name: THE THRONE
artifacts.blurb: What originated as an ugly stump most would turn into woodchips, became a throne built for Mother Nature herself.

artifacts.name: THE TILING
artifacts.blurb: Most tiling is relatively easy but if you want custom beauty nothing matches Moroccan.

artifacts.name: THE LIGHTS
artifacts.blurb: The Ketra lights are gorgeous, bright and highly customizable: push one button and your whole house is rainbow colored!

artifacts.name: THE BOOKCASE
artifacts.blurb: Why just store books when you can create a work of art and play music at the same time?

artifacts.name: THE BRAIN
artifacts.blurb: How many brains does an octopus have? Way more than humans. That’s the only way we could build this thing!

artifacts.name: THE STYLIST
artifacts.blurb: Did you know that octopi have stylists? I don’t wake up in the morning looking like this, guys. It takes effort and style.

artifacts.name: THE GARDENER
artifacts.blurb: Did you know that octopi have gardens? Oh right, The Beatles told you so.

artifacts.name: THE NINJA PAINTER
artifacts.blurb: Take a look at my ceiling sometime. It’s a painted work of art. How about the bookcase? Wow!

spaces.title: MAIN ROOM
spaces.subtitle: (Under The Eyes of Texas)
spaces.blurb: Great space for conversation, catching a game, or a party!

spaces.title: INDOOR LOUNGE
spaces.subtitle: The Moroccan Corner
spaces.blurb: Get away from Austin and into Morocco! Authentic Moroccan furniture creates a bright environment for cocktails and stories.

spaces.title: BACK DECK
spaces.subtitle: Party Time
spaces.blurb: A view of the city skyline with a private, escape surrounded by nature.

spaces.title: HOT TUB
spaces.subtitle: (The Oasis)
spaces.blurb: Finish the night with a luxurious dip in the hot tub. This spot is located in a shady garden surrounded by flowing waterfalls.
